bibl.title: Greek and Ge‘ez in the Propaganda of King ‘Ezana of Axum: Religion and Diplomacy in Late Antiquity.
bibl.note: Lecture given at a conference held in Tel Aviv University in February 1999. - The royal monuments of ‘Ezana [E. Bernand, A.J. Drewes & R. Schneider, Recueil des inscriptions de l'Éthiopie des périodes pré-axoumite et axoumite (Paris, 1991) Nos 185-185bis; 189; 270-271] show Christianity treated differently in the language of the Ethiopian king and in that of the emissaries and ecclesiastics coming from the Roman Empire, shedding some light on the difficulties that their alliance involved. - Avec résumés en anglais et en français.
